intro: Languas pahangensis, commonly known as the Pahang langus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Malaysia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a slightly waxy texture. Due to habitat loss, Languas pahangensis is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
